poem:
**Overtime at COP29**

Bridging gaps in overtime's embrace,  
as delegates dance the compromised waltz.  
Azerbaijan whispers in the last light,  
where promises fade like ink in rain.  
Climate hangs in balance,  
a see-saw of broken vows,  
each tick-tock echoing  
through corridors of hope.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cop 29 live: Poor countries may have to compromise on climate funding, says former UN envoy 9.04am GMT Azerbaijan has urged negotiators at the Cop29 summit to bridge their differences to come up with with a finance deal, as the UN climate talks looked set to, once again, run into overtime. In a note to delegates on Friday, reported by Reuters, the Cop29 presidency said: We encourage parties to continue to collaborate within and across". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Cop 29 live: Poor countries may have to compromise on climate funding, says former UN envoy 9.04am GMT Azerbaijan has urged negotiators at the Cop29 summit to bridge their differences to come up with with a finance deal, as the UN climate talks looked set to, once again, run into overtime. In a note to delegates on Friday, reported by Reuters, the Cop29 presidency said: We encourage parties to continue to collaborate within and across
